did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Two handwritten catalogs of American currency notes.

daodesc.p: Entries from one of the notebooks

scopecontent.p: Consists of two undated catalogs, one given the title “Colonial, Provincial, Continental and Early United States Notes, Index to Collection of H.P.B.,” which contains descriptions and contemporary values for various coins of the United States colonies. Included is a photocopy of a fifty shillings note dated November 1, 1709, and a typed letter to Harold Bouton from “CWB” (?) dated September 12, 1938, a copy of which was sent to Beach, discussing the preservation of the front door and door frame of George Washington’s headquarters. The other notebook is titled “Catalogue of Valid United States Notes, 1861 to the Present Time” and contains descriptions of various US currency notes but not their sale values.
